0.title: Landmines explode along LoC due to forest fire in J&K
0.article_body: A forest fire has triggered several landmine explosions along the LoC in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district, officials said on Wednesday. The landmines were part of the anti-infiltration obstacle system. "The forest fire has been raging for the past three days...This morning it started in Daramshal block and spread fast due to powerful winds," Forester Kanar Hussain Shah said.

1.title: Heroism is working again: Bhushan Kumar on success of South films
1.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, speaking about the recent success of South films, said, "They're pure entertainers. They have music, action, heroism, the mother element, the way it used to be in our 90s films." "They are presenting it at a high scale...it's working," he stated while adding that people won't watch scaled-down mass entertainers. "Heroism is working again," he concluded.

2.title: Ukraine 'lacks will' to continue peace talks: Russia
2.article_body: Russia has accused Ukraine of not wanting to continue talks to end hostilities amid the ongoing conflict between the two nations. "Talks are indeed not moving forward and we note...complete lack of will of Ukrainian negotiators to continue this process," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. This comes after Kyiv's negotiator Mykhailo Podolyak said that talks with Moscow were "on hold".

3.title: TN CM hails Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release from jail
3.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin reacted to release of Perarivalan, one of the convicts in ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, praising verdict for serving as an example of India's federalism. "Congratulations...to Perarivalan for fully breathing...the air of liberation [after over] 30 years of [jail]," he tweeted. Stalin also praised Perarivalan's mother for her perseverance during his imprisonment.

4.title: Battery car services to Vaishno Devi shrine suspended for the day
4.article_body: The battery car services to the Vaishno Devi shrine were suspended on the new track on Wednesday due to a forest fire in the Trikuta hills. However, the pilgrimage continued through the traditional track. The fire broke out near the Sanji Chhat helipad in the forest area of Trikuta hills on late Sunday evening.

5.title: World's tallest building Burj Khalifa vanishes in a layer of dust amid sandstorm
5.article_body: The world's tallest building Burj Khalifa disappeared behind a grey layer of dust today as sandstorms that have swept the Middle East hit the United Arab Emirates, prompting weather and traffic warnings. Capital city Abu Dhabi's air quality index (AQI) soared into the "hazardous" zone overnight. Authorities issued a nationwide warning urging residents to remain vigilant.

6.title: Nikhat reaches final at Women's World Boxing Championships; Manisha, Parveen win bronze
6.article_body: Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen defeated Brazil's Caroline De Almeida to enter the 52-kg category final at the Women's World Boxing Championships. Meanwhile, Manisha Moun bagged a bronze medal after losing in the semi-final against Tokyo Olympics bronze medallist Irma Testa. In the 63-kg category, Parveen Hooda bagged a bronze after losing to European Championships bronze medallist Amy Broadhurst.

7.title: LSG to bat first against KKR in their last league stage match, make 3 changes
7.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bat first against KKR in their last league stage clash in IPL 2022 on Wednesday. LSG have made three changes to their playing XI, with Manan Vohra, Evin Lewis and Krishnappa Gowtham replacing Ayush Badoni, Dushmantha Chameera and Krunal Pandya. KKR have replaced Ajinkya Rahane with Abhijeet Tomar.

8.title: India looks a lot like Sri Lanka: Rahul on graphs comparing economies
8.article_body: Congress' Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday accused the Centre of failing to curb inflation and employment crisis in the country and stated that "India looks a lot like Sri Lanka". Gandhi took to Twitter to share graphs comparing both countries' statistics on unemployment, petrol prices and communal violence. Notably, Sri Lanka is undergoing its worst economic crisis since its independence.

9.title: It deeply saddens us: Congress on Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release
9.article_body: After the Supreme Court ordered release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "The decision...deeply saddens us." "If those guilty of terrorism and assassination of a PM are going to be released like this, then who'll uphold the majesty and the integrity of law in this country," he asked.

10.title: Punjab govt agrees to farmers' demand on advancing paddy sowing
10.article_body: The Punjab government on Wednesday accepted the demands raised by the Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) by agreeing to advance the paddy transplantation in three phases beginning June 7. The earlier schedule of paddy transplantation consisted of four phases starting June 18. The government also agreed to buy moong (green grams) at MSP, for which the mandis have been identified.

11.title: I am leaving Twitter, it's not because of Elon: Twitter VP of Product Management
11.article_body: Ilya Brown, one of Twitter's latest three senior executives to leave Twitter, tweeted, "Yes, I'm leaving Twitter. No, it is not because of Elon or uncertainty inside the company." Ilya Brown, Twitter's Vice President of Product Management, said, "It has been an amazing six years and I've loved every second of it." Ilya added, "I will forever love this place."

12.title: Open to the idea of Chris Rock hosting Oscars 2023: ABC President
12.article_body: ABC President of Entertainment Craig Erwich has said that they are open to the idea of Chris Rock hosting the Academy Awards in 2023. This comes after actor Will Smith slapped Chris Rock during the 2022 event. "There was a...controversy, which overshadowed a lot of...positive things about the show, but I was really happy with the program," Craig said.

13.title: Pune's new art centre 'Zapurza' to be inaugurated on May 19
13.article_body: An all-inclusive art point named 'Zapurza' is set to be inaugurated in Pune on Thursday. The centre, which was reportedly under construction for four years, will house as many as eight galleries, an amphitheatre, an auditorium and will display various artworks from locations including Mumbai and Kolhapur. Additionally, there will be two separate galleries dedicated to jewellery and textiles.

14.title: Hyd Police arrests university VC in fake educational certificates scam
14.article_body: Hyderabad Police has arrested the vice-chancellor of Bhopal's Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan University in connection with a fake educational certificates scam. A former vice-chancellor has also been arrested. In February, four cases were registered against a few educational consultants and the management of the university for allegedly providing educational certificates in return for money.

15.title: Railway employee crushed to death by train in Gr Noida: Police
15.article_body: A 33-year-old railway employee died on duty after being run over by a train in Greater Noida on Wednesday morning, police said. The deceased, identified as Sunil Kumar Verma, was working on the rail track segment near Dadri when he got hit by the train, police added. Verma was reportedly working with the railway as technician grade one (signal).

16.title: I've to breathe: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict on release from jail after 31 yrs
16.article_body: AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, was released from jail after 31 years on the order of the Supreme Court today. As he stepped out, Perarivalan told reporters, "I have just come out...I've to breathe a bit. Give me some time." He further said he firmly believes "there's no need for capital punishment".

17.title: ₹25,000 aid will be given for rain-hit houses in B'luru: K'taka CM
17.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has announced that a compensation of ₹25,000 would be given each to those whose houses have been flooded and affected due to heavy rains in Bengaluru. Furthermore, Bommai also announced a compensation of ₹5 lakh each for the families of the two labourers who died due to heavy rainfall at a pipeline work site in Bengaluru.

18.title: I have the honour of having the most-liked tweet of any living human: Musk
18.article_body: Elon Musk said, "I have the honour of having the most-liked tweet of any living human. Thank you everyone for liking my tweet." Musk said that his tweet, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in," has over 4.8 million likes. Notably, the tweet announcing actor Chadwick Boseman's death is the most-liked ever, with over 7.1 million likes.

19.title: Protesting farmers to meet Punjab CM to discuss their demands
19.article_body: A group of protesting Punjab farmers on Wednesday said they'll meet CM Bhagwant Mann to discuss their demands. "[Deputy Commissioner] and SSP came to take us (for the meeting) and...message (for the meeting) is from CM sahab," said farmer leader Baldev Singh Sirsa. This comes after farmers protested near the Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday after being stopped from entering Chandigarh.

20.title: Tata Consumer Products in talks to acquire as many as 5 brands
20.article_body: Tata Consumer Products (TCP), the food and beverage arm of Tata Group, is in talks to acquire as many as five consumer brands. A "significant amount" of the Mumbai-based firm's future growth will come from inorganic expansion, TCP CEO Sunil D'Souza said. "We're reaching out to potential targets to have a chat to see if there is interest," D'Souza added.

21.title: BJP creating communal issues to divert attention from price hike: Mamata
21.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday alleged, "The Narendra Modi government is engineering communal disturbances to divert the attention of the common people." She accused the Centre of looting the common people by hiking the prices of domestic gas, petrol and diesel. Banerjee was addressing a party programme at Midnapore College ground.

22.title: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal resigns: Reports
22.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal has submitted his resignation to President Ram Nath Kovind, citing personal reasons, according to reports. He was appointed as the Delhi Lieutenant Governor in December, 2016 after Najeeb Jung had resigned from the post. He had previously served as the Union Home Secretary.

23.title: Video shows white man urinating on black student's books, laptop in SA; students protest
23.article_body: Students have launched protests at South Africa's Stellenbosch University after a video showing a white student urinating on a black student's personal belongings, including books and laptop, surfaced online. The accused, who has been identified as 25-year-old Theuns Du Toit, has been suspended. "It's a White thing, boy," Du Toit reportedly told the student after urinating on his things.

24.title: 959 Ukrainian fighters in Mariupol surrendered so far: Russia
24.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry said 694 Ukrainian fighters who'd been holed up in Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, last bastion of Ukrainian resistance in the city, have surrendered over the past 24 hours. So far, 959 soldiers at the plant have handed themselves over to Russian troops, it added. Ukraine has offered to release Russian prisoners of war in exchange for Mariupol fighters.

25.title: K'taka HC quashes BBMP's demand of ₹69 lakh from 150-year-old school
25.article_body: The Karnataka High Court quashed Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) notice demanding ₹69 lakh from 150-year-old Good Shepherd Convent school and said that the demand has "no legal legs to stand". In 2014, the school made application to BBMP seeking licence to construct four additional floors and paid ₹1,61,438 as scrutiny fee but BBMP demanded ₹69 lakh as betterment charge.

26.title: I competed with myself in bettering what I did last: Jaaved on his projects
26.article_body: Speaking about his career choices, Jaaved Jaaferi said, "I wanted to be happy with what I was doing. Most of the work I did, I did connect to it but sometimes you do things as you need to do it." "I...competed with myself in bettering what I did last," he added. Jaaved further said now he wants to do better.

27.title: People within Cong have no faith in party: Owaisi on Hardik Patel's exit
27.article_body: Reacting to Hardik Patel's departure from Congress ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that those within Congress don't have any faith in party. "Congress ruled Maharashtra for 15 years but now...party has slipped to third position...Congress is nowhere to be seen in Delhi," he added. Patel resigned as working president of Congress' Gujarat unit earlier today.

28.title: No matter what size you are, people will discuss it: Sonakshi on body shaming
28.article_body: During an interview, actress Sonakshi Sinha said both she and actress Huma Qureshi have faced body and weight-shaming for years during the initial years of their careers. "It happened from the beginning of our careers in this line and it still happens. It hasn't stopped," she added. "No matter what size you are, people are always discussing it," Sonakshi said.

29.title: Rahul Tripathi should be in the mix for Team India: Ravi Shastri
29.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri has said SRH batter Rahul Tripathi is "not far" from receiving an India call-up. He added, "If someone gets injured, this guy can be slotted in straight away...Rahul Tripathi is a dangerous player and should be in the mix." Shastri further said, "If he's performing season after season, I'm sure the selectors will be watching."

30.title: It is good that Hardik Patel left the party: Gujarat Cong incharge
30.article_body: Gujarat Congress incharge Raghu Sharma on Wednesday said it was good that Hardik Patel left the party as Patel's personal ambitions were larger than Congress' ideology. Sharma said Hardik was insecure of losing his space in the party if Rajkot-based businessman Naresh Patel joined the party. Hardik resigned from Congress' primary membership on Wednesday.

31.title: ITBP rescues 2 trekkers, stranded for over 48 hours in U'khand
31.article_body: A team of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) rescued two trekkers, who were stranded for over 48 hours, during an expedition in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh, a senior officer said on Wednesday. Vishal Gangwar and Santosh Kumar started their trek to Khaliya Top on Sunday and got stranded near Birthi fall in Munsiyari. They are being brought to safety through land route.

32.title: Big mistake: Mackie on Kim Kardashian wearing Marilyn Monroe's gown
32.article_body: Designer Bob Mackie, speaking about Kim Kardashian wearing Marilyn Monroe's gown at Met Gala, said, "I thought it was a big mistake." "[Marilyn] was a goddess. A crazy goddess, but a goddess...it was done for her. It was designed for her. Nobody else should be seen in that dress," he added. Kim had worn Marilyn's original 1962 Jean Louis gown.

33.title: Kareena is very polite & down to earth: Chef who cooked for her in Kalimpong
33.article_body: Kareena Kapoor, who has been shooting in Kalimpong for Sujoy Ghosh's 'Devotion of Suspect X', posted stories about a bakery in the hills named Neena's Kitchen. She tagged one of the dishes as the "best meal ever" and also praised the dessert. Reacting to it, chef Neena who cooked for her said, "Kareena is very polite and down to earth."

34.title: 19-yr-old man enters 13-yr-old relative's house, rapes her in Pune; booked
34.article_body: Pune Police have booked a 19-year-old man for allegedly raping his 13-year-old relative. According to police, the accused and the victim stay in the same neighbourhood. The FIR based on the complaint filed, said that the man entered the girl's house when her family was away and took advantage of the absence of her family.

35.title: Bhagyashree breaks down at son Abhimanyu's 'Nikamma' trailer launch
35.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree got emotional at the trailer launch of her son Abhimanyu Dassani's film 'Nikamma'. She added, "He has put a lot of effort into this film. The shooting of this film...went on for two years during COVID-19." "He has done...[a] good work [and]...worked so hard...Just keep this nikamma in your heart," Bhagyashree said.

36.title: Heart-rending: PM Modi after 12 die in Guj wall collapse incident
36.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday condoled the loss of lives after 12 labourers were killed when a wall of a factory collapsed in the Morbi district of Gujarat. Taking to Twitter, PM Modi said, "The tragedy in Morbi caused by a wall collapse is heart-rending." He further announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of the deceased.

37.title: Special arrangements made for animals at Tanday Deer Park amid rising heat
37.article_body: Special arrangements have been made for the animals at Tanday Rakh and Mantalai Deer Park in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur during summer. "With the prolonged dry spell and forest fires, we ensure to enrich their diet; provide watermelon, cucumber, agro-feed, green fodder and 24-hour water supply," a forest guard said. "We sprinkle water in sheds to cool them," he added.

38.title: Taliban ask female UN staffers to wear hijab, say will monitor
38.article_body: The Taliban-led government of Afghanistan has reportedly issued a statement asking female staff members of the UN Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA) to wear hijab. The Ministry of Propagation of Virtue and Prevention of Vice said that its personnel will stand outside the UNAMA office to monitor if the women are wearing hijab or not.

39.title: Will retain neutral status: Austria after Sweden-Finland NATO bid
39.article_body: Austrian Foreign Minister Alexander Schallenberg said Austria would retain its neutral status even as Sweden and Finland overhauled decades-long foreign policy stances to apply for NATO membership amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Schallenberg added that Austria, which obtains 80% of its natural gas from Russia, would continue to provide humanitarian support to Ukraine rather than lethal weapons.

40.title: Matthew Mott appointed England men's white-ball team head coach
40.article_body: Former Australia Women coach Matthew Mott has been appointed the head coach of England men's white-ball cricket team. He has been appointed on a contract of four years. Under Mott, Australia Women won consecutive T20 World Cups and one 50-over World Cup, went four Ashes series undefeated and also set the world record for most consecutive ODI victories (26).

41.title: Hadn't hiked prices for Kabir Singh, it did over ₹270 cr at box office: Producer
41.article_body: 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad Khetani said that the ticket prices were not hiked for the movie. "It did over ₹270 crore at the box office. The footfalls of Kabir Singh are higher than the biggest blockbusters of 2019. I believe, if your film is good, it ends up collecting well at the box office," he added.

42.title: Deepika, others dance as Mame Khan sings at inauguration of India Pavilion at Cannes
42.article_body: Folk artist Mame Khan sang during the inauguration of India Pavilion at the 75th Cannes Film Festival. A video of his performance was shared by Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Twitter. Actresses Deepika Padukone, Urvashi Rautela, Tamannaah Bhatia and Pooja Hegde were seen dancing in the video as Khan sang.

43.title: One day, India won't have to be at Cannes, Cannes will be in India: Deepika
43.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, during the inauguration of the India Pavilion at the 75th Cannes Film Festival, said, "There will come a day, I truly believe, where India won't have to be at Cannes, [but] Cannes will be in India." She added, "We have a long way to go as a country...we have the talent, the ability...we just need that conviction."

44.title: Mushfiqur beats Tamim to become first Bangladesh batter to reach 5,000 Test runs
44.article_body: Mushfiqur Rahim has beaten Tamim Iqbal in the race to reach 5,000 Test runs, becoming the first Bangladesh batter to reach the milestone. Rahim achieved the feat during his 105-run knock in Bangladesh's first innings in first Test against Sri Lanka. He has scored 5,037 Test runs. Tamim, who scored 133 runs in the innings, has scored 4,981 Test runs.

45.title: Traffic constable breaks down after BJP MLA's relatives drag him to police station in UP
45.article_body: A video clip of a traffic police constable breaking down at a police station in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao has gone viral. According to reports, some people claiming to be relatives of BJP MLA Ashutosh Shukla dragged the constable to the station after he stopped their SUV with a hooter and BJP flag. The accused allegedly threatened him with dire consequences.

46.title: Depp said, 'We're married now, I can punch Amber in face': Amber's friend
46.article_body: Amber Heard's friend iO Tillett Wright, in pre-recorded testimony played in court, recalled his conversation with Johnny Depp at the couple's wedding in February 2015 in the Bahamas. "Depp said, 'We're married now. I can punch her (Amber) in the face...nobody can do anything about it'," claimed Wright. Earlier, Amber had alleged that Depp hit her during their honeymoon.

47.title: It was runaway hit, I played 40-year-old Champu at 22: Neena on Marathi play
47.article_body: Actress Neena Kulkarni took to Instagram to share her picture from the back page of the printed classic Marathi play 'Mahasagar'. "I remember I was stoked to be on the cover! All of 22 years then, I played role of a 40-year-old Champu. It was a runaway hit...800 odd shows! And it had a super cast," she wrote.

48.title: Tesla to show sneak preview of humanoid Tesla Bot on AI Day in Aug
48.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has confirmed in a tweet that the firm will be showing a sneak preview of its humanoid Tesla Bot in August. The preview will be shown on August 19, when Tesla is holding its second AI Day. "The purpose of AI Day is to convince great AI/software/chip talent to join Tesla," Musk had tweeted earlier.

49.title: I want to be known as the woman who lived her life queen-sized: Malaika Arora
49.article_body: Actress Malaika describes her childhood as 'tumultuous'. She said that her tough times also taught her some important lessons. "Those early lessons are the cornerstones of my life and professional journey. I am still fiercely independent; I value my freedom," she added. Malaika further said that she wants to be known as the woman who lived her life queen-sized.

50.title: Change of pace, length is what makes Arshdeep stand out: Ian Bishop
50.article_body: Ex-WI fast bowler Ian Bishop has said PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh's "change of pace and length" makes him stand out among the young pacers in the ongoing IPL season. "Arshdeep has good accuracy and a great feel for knowing when to bowl what type of delivery," explained Bishop. So far, Arshdeep has picked 10 wickets in 13 games.

51.title: Kolkata port to export 4,000 tonnes of wheat to B'desh amid export ban
51.article_body: Kolkata's Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port is set to export 4,000 tonnes of wheat to Bangladesh by May 13 amid the Centre's wheat export ban order. Notably, Centre relaxed its previous order on Tuesday, stating that consignments handed over to customs on or prior to May 13 would be allowed for export. India has halted wheat exports to ensure food security.

52.title: Sri Lankan police arrest 2 ruling party lawmakers over mob violence
52.article_body: Sri Lankan police have arrested two ruling party lawmakers for allegedly instigating mob violence that plunged the country into days of unrest and left nine people dead and over 200 injured last week. "There is direct evidence against the...MPs," an official said. Sanath Nishantha and Milan Jayathilake were among several politicians banned from leaving Sri Lanka over May 9 violence.

53.title: UK inflation hits 9% in April, its highest level since 1982
53.article_body: Consumer price inflation in the United Kingdom reached 9% in April 2022, its highest level since 1982. British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak said countries around the world were being hit by high inflation and the jump in inflation in UK reflected the increase in regulated energy tariffs. "We cannot protect people completely from these global challenges," Sunak said.

54.title: Rupee closes at a new all-time low of 77.58 against US dollar
54.article_body: The Indian rupee closed at a new all-time low of 77.58 against the US dollar on Wednesday. The Indian rupee had closed at 77.47 against the US dollar on Tuesday. Meanwhile, the stock market slipped into the red, halting a two-day upward trend. Sensex settled at 54,209 points, while the Nifty stood at 16,240 points.

55.title: HC seeks Delhi govt's reply on making Yoga Science compulsory till Class 8
55.article_body: The Delhi High Court has sought a response from the Centre, Delhi government and NCERT on a PIL to make Health and Yoga Science compulsory for students till Class 8. The petitioner has submitted that the Right to Health and Right to Education are complementary and supplementary to each other. He said yoga is a medical and life science.

56.title: It was luck that 19th over vs MI turned out to be maiden: Bhuvneshwar
56.article_body: SRH's Bhuvneshwar Kumar, while interacting with Umran Malik, said that it was "luck" that the 19th over against MI turned out to be maiden. "I felt the yorker was the best option on that wicket to prevent run-scoring...Luckily, all deliveries landed in a good spot," he added. MI needed 19 off 12 to win when Bhuvneshwar bowled the maiden over.

57.title: Trump's social media firm may raise $50 mn before SPAC deal closes
57.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's social media venture has said it may raise up to $50 million through convertible notes before it merges with a blank-check acquisition firm, filings revealed. TMTG raised $38.2 million through issuance of convertible promissory notes, as of March 31. TMTG is set to receive $1.25 billion in funding once it merges with Digital World Acquisition.

58.title: Stones hurled at Dalit man's marriage procession over DJ music in MP
58.article_body: A Dalit man's marriage procession was allegedly attacked by few people in MP's Rajgarh district, following a dispute over DJ music being played during the celebration, which left three people injured. The procession was passing outside a mosque at around 11 pm, when some people of a community objected to DJ music being played during the celebration, the police said.

59.title: IndiGo names Pieter Elbers as CEO, Ronojoy Dutta to retire
59.article_body: IndiGo on Wednesday announced the appointment of Pieter Elbers as the airline's CEO, subject to regulatory approvals. The 52-year-old will join IndiGo on or before October 1, 2022, and will succeed 71-year-old Ronojoy Dutta, who has decided to retire on September 30, 2022. Since 2014, Elbers has served as the President & CEO of KLM Royal Dutch Airlines.

60.title: Guy emptied my pouch, stole money, cards at a Europe train station: Kangana
60.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut recalled that she was robbed by a person at a train station in Europe during one of her trips. "I had a Louis Vuitton pouch and a backpack. The guy was so sharp, he came and stole my money, a few thousand dollars...cards...I noticed that he'd emptied my pouch...my passport was with me," she said.

61.title: Hindu College professor booked over post on Shivling, says 'didn't expect threats'
61.article_body: Ratan Lal, an assistant professor from Delhi University's Hindu College, has been booked over an alleged derogatory Facebook post referring to claims of a Shivling being found at the Gyanvapi mosque. "I was not expecting threats and abuses for this statement...In our country, religious feelings get hurt over anything," Lal said after the complaint. He has sought police protection.

62.title: Ex-Tripura CM Biplab Deb named in 'fake CIA report', wife files complaint
62.article_body: Former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb's wife filed a police complaint alleging that a fake Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) report is being circulated on social media in the name of her husband. It is being circulated to infringe the security of the nation as a result of a deep-rooted conspiracy, she claimed. Deb on Saturday resigned as Tripura CM.

63.title: Love how everyone seems to know more about my life than me: Arjun amid wedding rumours
63.article_body: After rumours of his wedding with actress Malaika Arora, actor Arjun Kapoor took to his Instagram Stories to say that he loves how everyone seems to know more about his life than he does. Media reports had earlier said that Malaika and Arjun will have a winter wedding this year. Recently, he had also said people in India love gossiping.

64.title: BJP wants to take India back to 1990s when riots ensued: Owaisi
64.article_body: Speaking about the Gyanvapi Mosque case, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that the BJP wants to take the country back to the 1990s when riots ensued. "It's a fountain (inside the mosque)," Owaisi added. "If it happens like this then all the fountains of the Taj Mahal must be shut down," he stated.

65.title: Karnataka CM Bommai inspects rain-affected areas in Bengaluru
65.article_body: Amid heavy rainfall in Bengaluru, Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday inspected the rain-affected areas in the state capital. BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi, state ministers R Ashoka and Munirathna also accompanied the CM during the inspection. Bengaluru saw heavy rains on Tuesday night, which led to severe flooding in many areas of the city.

66.title: Another suspect involved in robbing temples in Canada arrested
66.article_body: The Canadian police have arrested a fourth suspect in connection with the multiple incidents of robberies and vandalisations of religious places, which mainly included Hindu temples. The accused has been identified as Gurdeep Pandher, a 37-year-old resident of Brampton town. As many as 13 such incidents were reported between November 2021 and March 2022 in Ontario.

67.title: I'm scared with money after financial lows, always looking to save: Divyanka
67.article_body: Television actress Divyanka Tripathi said that she is always scared with money and is always looking to save. "Especially when you have seen too many lows...it's that way with me," she added. Divyanka also mentioned that her father was skeptical about her joining the industry and that he came and stayed with her for a week.

68.title: BBMP estimates 1,000 houses flooded amid rains in B'luru: Report
68.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has estimated that around 1,000 houses have been flooded due to the heavy rains in the city, according to a report. Two labourers have reportedly died amid heavy rainfall in the city on Wednesday. Meanwhile, the IMD has issued an orange alert for Bengaluru, predicting heavy rainfall for the next four-five days in the city.

69.title: Calcutta HC asks Partha Chatterjee to appear before CBI over SSC case
69.article_body: The Calcutta High Court on Wednesday ordered West Bengal Minister and TMC leader Partha Chatterjee to appear before CBI by 6 pm today in connection with the alleged SSC recruitment irregularities. The order came after a division bench of court upheld the orders of a single bench on Wednesday that directed the CBI to inquire into alleged illegal appointments.

70.title: 2 critically injured after falling from Delhi's Nirman Bhawan building
70.article_body: Two people were critically injured after one of them allegedly fell from the sixth floor of the under-renovation Nirman Bhawan building in Delhi on Wednesday. The labourers received injuries on their head and hands, a fire department official said. The fire department rushed four fire tenders to the spot after receiving a call about the incident at 12:38 pm.

71.title: Depp told me about rage activities with Winona & Kate: Amber's friend
71.article_body: Amber Heard's friend iO Tillett Wright, in pre-recorded testimony played in court, said Johnny Depp had told him he experienced "great bouts of jealousy" in his relationships. Wright added Depp said it led to "a lot of drinking...a lot of rage activities". "Depp told me...that happened with...Winona Ryder....Kate Moss," Wright said. "Depp told me...that happened with Vanessa Paradis," he stated.

72.title: I'd love to recreate my iconic look of 'Poo' from 'Kabhi Khushi...': Kareena
72.article_body: In a recent interview, when actress Kareena Kapoor was asked which iconic look from her films she'd like to recreate, Kareena said, "Since 'Poo' from 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' is one of my most iconic characters, I would love to recreate that look of mine." Meanwhile, on the work front, Kareena has begun shooting for Sujoy Ghosh's next.

73.title: Inflation, unemployment making new records: Sachin Pilot criticises Centre
73.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot targeted the BJP-led central government over rising inflation and unemployment in the country. "Inflation and unemployment are making new records day by day under the directionless and failed governance of the central government," he tweeted. "With...wholesale inflation registering 15.08% in...April, inflation...has reached the highest level of 24 years," he added.

74.title: Mahinda makes 1st appearance in Sri Lankan parliament since quitting as PM
74.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa made his first appearance in parliament on Wednesday since stepping down as PM amid economic crisis. This comes a day after no-confidence motion against his brother and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was defeated in parliament. Mahinda Rajapaksa sought refuge at naval base last week as his house was set ablaze by protesters amid clashes.

75.title: Ratan Tata visits Taj Hotel in Nano without bodyguards; video goes viral
75.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata was spotted visiting Taj Hotel in his Tata Nano without any bodyguard accompanying him, a video shared by Viral Bhayani showed. Bhayani said that Ratan Tata was escorted by the hotel staff. Several people praised him on social media, with a social media user saying, "Exemplary simplicity personified."

76.title: No one has ever won battle against farmers: Sidhu to Punjab CM
76.article_body: Following a protest staged by Punjab farmers near the Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday, Congress’ Navjot Singh Sidhu urged Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to "amicably" settle their issues. "No one has ever won a battle against the farmers," Sidhu tweeted on Wednesday. "Urge you not to go on a collision course with farmers...who are the backbone of Punjab’s economy," Sidhu added.

77.title: Top engineer who quit Apple over return-to-office policy joins Google: Report
77.article_body: Ian Goodfellow, who quit as Apple's Director of Machine Learning over the company's return-to-office policy, is joining Google parent Alphabet's AI unit DeepMind, Bloomberg reported. He worked in different capacities for Google since 2013, before joining Apple in 2019. He's best known for inventing Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), a class of machine learning frameworks.

78.title: UFOs spotted 400 times by US military, reveals US govt
78.article_body: The US military has had 11 close encounters with UFOs, a top Pentagon intelligence official has told Congress. In the first public hearing of its kind in over half a century, intelligence chiefs revealed they had recorded around 400 UFO sightings in total. Senior Pentagon officials said no evidence of extraterrestrial origins had been discovered so far.

79.title: Everyone is newborn care specialist: Nick Jonas on receiving parenting advice
79.article_body: When asked if people have been giving him advice on how to care for his newborn daughter, Malti, singer Nick Jonas said, "Turns out everybody I know is a newborn care specialist, all these PhDs I didn't know they had." When asked how his brothers have reacted to the baby's arrival, Nick said, "Amazing. They got kids of their own."

80.title: Even the biggest of players can struggle: Ishan on his form in IPL 2022
80.article_body: Talking about his form in the ongoing IPL season, MI opener Ishan Kishan said that even the best of cricketers can "struggle" at some point. He added, "I have seen the likes of Chris Gayle taking time (to start hitting)...Some day, you get a good start, some day, opposition bowlers come prepared." Ishan has scored 370 runs in 13 games.

81.title: These allegations are written by BJP: Cong MP on Hardik’s resignation
81.article_body: Soon after Hardik Patel resigned from primary membership of Congress saying that the party only played the role of a "roadblock", party leader Shaktisinh Gohil said that these allegations are written down by BJP. These allegations have not been made by someone who has quit Congress, Gohil added. "They just speak it out loud," Gohil stated.

82.title: T'gana govt owes Hyd civic body ₹5,258 cr in property taxes: RTI reply
82.article_body: The Telangana government owes the Hyderabad civic body ₹5,258 crore in property taxes, as per an RTI response. Some of the dues are pending for nearly 25 years, The Print reported. The police department has not paid dues of ₹420 crore for 12 years and the medical department owes ₹1,185 crore over the last 23 years, the RTI reply added.

83.title: Apple delays plan requiring employees to come to office 3 days a week
83.article_body: Apple has delayed its plan that required its employees to come to the office three days a week, according to a memo seen by Bloomberg. Apple said that the requirement is being delayed "for the time being", without providing a new date. The technology company still requires its employees to come to the office two days a week.

84.title: Give central contract to Umran Malik straight away: Ravi Shastri
84.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that the BCCI should give central contract to SRH fast bowler Umran Malik "straight away". "Don't let him float around...keep him in the mix with the main players and let him learn by being around the Shamis and Bumrahs," Shastri added about the 22-year-old cricketer, who is the fastest bowler in IPL 2022.

85.title: Russian gymnast Kuliak banned for 1 year for wearing 'Z' war symbol on chest at World Cup
85.article_body: Russian gymnast Ivan Kuliak has been given a one-year ban for wearing 'Z' national war symbol on the podium at Apparatus World Cup in Qatar in March. Kuliak earned bronze in parallel bars final and displayed a letter 'Z' taped to his chest as he stood next to gold medallist, Ukraine's Illia Kovtun. He'll also have to return his medal.

86.title: 'Excuse me?' Amber after Depp's lawyer claims she got Aquaman due to actor
86.article_body: Amber Heard has denied the claim that Johnny Depp got her the role of Mera in 'Aquaman'. Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez, while cross-examining Heard during the trial, suggested Amber got 'Aquaman' due to Depp. To this, Amber said, "Excuse me? No...I got myself that role by auditioning." Earlier, Amber had said she "fought hard" to stay in 'Aquaman 2'.

87.title: Won't arrest MP Navneet Rana, her husband till June 9: Mumbai Police
87.article_body: Mumbai Police told a court they would not arrest Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana till June 9 in connection with Hanuman Chalisa case. June 9 is the date of hearing on police's plea seeking their bail cancellation. Rana and her husband were arrested after they had announced to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Uddhav Thackeray's private residence.

88.title: No plans to block YouTube or cut ourselves off from internet: Russia
88.article_body: Russia's minister of communications Maksut Shadayev said Russia is not planning to shut YouTube in the country. He said that such a move would likely see Russian users suffer and should therefore be avoided. He added Russia doesn't want to cut itself off from global internet infrastructure, saying, "We think that Russia should remain a part of the global network."

89.title: Horatti resigns as chief of K'taka Legislative Council, joins BJP
89.article_body: Former senior JD(S) leader Basavaraj Horatti on Wednesday joined the BJP after resigning as the Chairman of Karnataka Legislative Council and MLC. He joined the BJP in the presence of Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai and BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi, among others. "[Horatti's] joining has strengthened the party...We'll...give him all the opportunities and respects he deserves," Bommai said.

90.title: Jamia Millia Islamia PG students stage protest against offline exams
90.article_body: A group of students pursuing postgraduate courses in Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) on Tuesday gathered in front of the office of the university's proctor and staged a protest against offline exams. The students raised slogans demanding that exams should be conducted online. Meanwhile, the university said as classes were conducted offline, the exams will also be conducted in physical mode.

91.title: 2 sisters, mother poison family over their objection to girls' marriage with boyfriends
91.article_body: Noida police have arrested five people including two sisters, their mother and their boyfriends for allegedly attempting to poison their family. Police said the sisters laced the dinner of four family members with a poisonous substance because of their objection to their marriage with their boyfriends. The victims were rushed to hospital after another family member found them unconscious.

92.title: Johnny Depp smiles as Amber Heard's lawyer imitates his voice, video viral
92.article_body: In a video that has been shared by several internet users, Johnny Depp can be seen smiling after Amber Heard's lawyer is heard imitating his voice. While talking about Depp not looking at Amber during her testimony, Amber's attorney Elaine Bredehoft can be heard saying, "She played...a tape...where Johnny said, 'You will not see my...eyes again'. Do you...recall that?"

93.title: Ayodhya Ram temple construction on schedule, says authority
93.article_body: The construction of Ram Temple in Ayodhya is going as per schedule, an official statement said. Temple construction committee chairman Nripendra Misra said that the ground floor 'garbha griha' (sanctum sanctorum) will be complete by December 2023, while the remaining work will be done by December 2024. The construction of the plinth is expected to be completed by August 2022.

94.title: Ruchi Soya to acquire Patanjali's food retail business for ₹690 crore
94.article_body: Ruchi Soya on Wednesday said it'll be acquiring Patanjali Ayurved's food retail business for an amount of consideration of ₹690 crore. Post-acquisition, Ruchi Soya will be called 'Patanjali Foods' and will acquire Patanjali Ayurved's manufacturing plants in Padartha (Uttarakhand) and Newasa (Maharashtra). In 2019, Baba Ramdev's Patanjali had acquired Ruchi Soya through an insolvency process.

95.title: 4, including 2 children, missing from Pune found dead at Alibaug lodge
95.article_body: A 25-year-old woman, her two children, and a 29-year-old man who had gone missing from the Pune district on May 2 were found dead inside a tourist cottage in Alibaug on Tuesday afternoon. Police suspect the man and woman, who were allegedly in an extra-marital relationship, poisoned the three-year-old boy and five-year-old girl and then died by suicide by hanging.

96.title: LSG will undoubtedly target Shreyas with bouncers: Shastri
96.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer will have to "give himself time" to score runs in their final league match against LSG on Wednesday. Shastri added that LSG will "undoubtedly" target him with short balls and he'll have to show his "readiness against it". Shreyas is KKR's top run-getter with 351 runs in 13 games.

97.title: India test fires first indigenously developed naval anti-ship missile
97.article_body: Indian Navy on Wednesday successfully carried out the maiden test firing of the first indigenously developed naval anti-ship missile from a Seaking 42B helicopter, officials said. "This firing is a significant step towards achieving self-reliance in niche missile technology and reaffirms the Indian Navy's commitment to indigenisation," said a senior Navy official. The test was conducted in Odisha.

98.title: 2 booked for extortion threat of ₹10.85 crore to Pune builder
98.article_body: Pune's Hinjewadi Police have booked two persons for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹10.85 crore from a city-based builder. The accused, identified as Chandu Laxmandas Ramnani and Kiran Chandu Ramnani, allegedly accused the builder of committing fraud by not having disclosed type of land he was carrying out construction on. Police have booked the accused under relevant sections of IPC.

99.title: Registration for K'taka govt's mango farm trips to start soon: Official
99.article_body: The Karnataka State Mango Development and Marketing Corporation Limited will soon begin registration for mango-picking tourism on its website. Mango tours to farms will be held on Sundays wherein the corporation will take people to the mango farms in the Ramanagara or Kolar districts from Bengaluru. Farmers sell fruits at a lesser price during the tour, an official said.

100.title: I'm trying to learn from every situation: Rahul Tripathi on 76(44) vs MI
100.article_body: SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, who scored 76(44) against MI on Tuesday, said he enjoyed batting at number three and he's trying to learn from every situation. On facing Jasprit Bumrah, Tripathi said, "Bumrah's a great bowler...and I was just looking to react to whatever he's bowling. Depends on how the wicket is playing, how I can counterattack at that point."

101.title: Newly married man loses hand as gift from sister-in-law's ex-lover explodes in Gujarat
101.article_body: A newly married man and his three-year-old nephew were critically injured after a wedding gift, which he allegedly received from his sister-in-law's ex-boyfriend, exploded in Gujarat's Navsari district. Apart from suffering severe injuries to his arms, head and eyes, his right wrist was cut off from the arm. A police complaint has been filed by his family.

102.title: Fire breaks out near judges' chamber in Delhi court, no one injured
102.article_body: A fire broke out near a chamber of judges on the second floor of the Rohini Court in Delhi on Wednesday. No injuries were reported in the incident, officials said, adding that five fire tenders were sent to the spot. The blaze started in an air-conditioner in a room near the judges' chamber, Delhi Fire Service Director Atul Garg said.

103.title: Iran seizes foreign ship with smuggled fuel, detains crew members
103.article_body: Authorities in Iran have seized a foreign ship attempting to smuggle fuel out of the country and detained its crew members, state news agency IRNA reported on Wednesday. The ship, carrying over 5,50,000 litres of smuggled fuel, was seized in Gulf waters, the agency added. Iranian authorities have detained several ships in recent months for smuggling fuel in the Gulf.

104.title: Cong will be tail party in India, regional parties will take lead: TRS MLC
104.article_body: TRS MLC Kavitha Kalvakuntla reacted to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remarks on regional parties and said his party will become a "tail party" in the country in future and regional parties will take lead. "Regional parties have a clear agenda for people. Rahulji should understand that even in Maharashtra they're in power because of a regional party there," Kavitha added.

105.title: One must do things the India way to be profitable there: Stellantis
105.article_body: Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares has said that western automakers can be profitable in India if they do things the "India way". He added that amid global disruption in Europe and China, India has a "bigger opportunity" to grow in the global automotive industry as well as within Stellantis. The firm will be launching its first EV in India next year.

106.title: In extortion bid, 4 goons set petrol pump on fire in Bihar's Gaya
106.article_body: Four goons allegedly set a petrol pump afire in an extortion bid in Bihar's Gaya. According to the employees, the goons, who arrived on two bikes, asked them to fill their tanks and refused to pay. Instead, they demanded extortion from them. When denied, they set the pump's vending nozzles, a parked school bus and bike on fire and fled.

107.title: Gujarat Congress busy ensuring chicken sandwich delivery for Delhi leaders: Hardik
107.article_body: Hardik Patel, who resigned as Gujarat Congress working president and left the Congress party on Wednesday, in his resignation letter claimed that big Congress leaders in Gujarat were "far away from issues of Gujarat". He added, "They are more focussed on ensuring that chicken sandwich for leaders who have come from Delhi is delivered on time!"

108.title: Researcher shows way Teslas could be unlocked using vulnerability
108.article_body: NCC Group researcher Sultan Qasim Khan has demonstrated the way he unlocked a Tesla using a vulnerability he said Tesla has been informed about. He unlocked a 2020 Tesla Model 3 using a vulnerability in the BLE technology on which the entry system relies. He added any smart locks using BLE technology could be unlocked in the same way.

109.title: 2 friends drown in Saharanpur's Yamuna canal while bathing
109.article_body: Two friends reportedly drowned in the Yamuna canal at Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur, police said on Tuesday. Yuvraj (20) and Devesh (21), along with another person, went to take a bath in the canal but accidentally moved to the deeper side. While locals managed to save the third person, the two deceased were washed away in the strong current, police said.

110.title: Criticising RBI for delayed rate hike is unfair: Ex-RBI Governor
110.article_body: Ex-RBI Governor D Subbarao on Wednesday said criticism that RBI is behind the delayed interest rate hike is unfair. "With credit growth currently only around 9-10%, the recent repo rate hike is unlikely to transmit very strongly," Subbarao said. Unlike most large economies, India is structurally supply-constrained and that itself is a safety valve for India against stagflation, he added.

111.title: Heat wave warning issued for several states over 5 days, IMD releases list
111.article_body: The IMD has issued heat wave warning for several states over five days. Heat wave conditions will likely be witnessed in Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana and Madhya Pradesh on May 19 and 20. Maharashtra will likely witness heat wave conditions from May 18 to 21. Meanwhile, heat wave conditions are likely in Uttar Pradesh today and over Odisha on May 22.

112.title: BJP trying to divert attention from unemployment, inflation: Mayawati on Gyanvapi case
112.article_body: Reacting to the Gyanvapi mosque controversy, BSP chief Mayawati said that BJP and its associates are targeting religious places to divert people's attention from unemployment and inflation. "Years after independence, the manner in which religious sentiments of people are being instigated under a conspiracy, under the pretext of Gyanvapi, Mathura...will not strengthen the country," she added.

113.title: Wall collapses at salt factory in Gujarat's Morbi, at least 12 workers killed
113.article_body: At least 12 labourers were killed after a wall of a salt factory collapsed in the Morbi district of Gujarat on Wednesday, an official said. Several people are feared trapped under the debris. A rescue operation has been started and the injured persons have been shifted to a nearby hospital.

114.title: Historic day: MP CM on SC's nod to OBC reservation in local body polls
114.article_body: Reacting to Supreme Court's decision giving approval to OBC reservation in MP's local body polls, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "It's a historic day. Satyamev Jayate!" "It has been proven again that truth can't lose," he added. It was because of the Congress that it was earlier directed that polls would be held without OBC reservation, he further said.

115.title: Vedantu lays off 424 employees, CEO says 'I am truly sorry'
115.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Vedantu is laying off 424 of its 5,900 employees. "I am truly sorry," Vedantu CEO Vamsi Krishna told laid-off employees. In an e-mail to all Vedantu employees, he wrote, "External environment is tough. War in Europe, impending recession fears, and Fed rate interest hikes have led to inflationary pressures with massive correction in stocks...capital will be scarce."

116.title: Depp knows he's lying, I survived that man & I'm able to look at him: Amber
116.article_body: Amber Heard, when asked about Johnny Depp not looking at her during her testimony, said that he knows he is guilty and lying. "Otherwise why can't he look at me...I survived that man...and I'm able to look at him," Heard said. Depp's lawyer had asked Heard if it was true that actor promised that she'd never see his eyes again.

117.title: US approves COVID-19 vaccine booster for children aged 5 to 11
117.article_body: The United States has approved the administration of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine booster dose for children aged from five to 11 years. The US Food and Drug Administration said that the move will provide continued protection against COVID-19. The children in this age group will be given a low-dose shot of 10 micrograms, compared to 30 microgram doses for older people.

118.title: We intend to close the transaction and enforce Musk merger agreement: Twitter board
118.article_body: Twitter Inc's board said it plans to enforce its $44 billion agreement to be bought by Elon Musk, saying the transaction is in the best interest of all shareholders. "We intend to close the transaction," the board said on Tuesday in a statement to Bloomberg News. The proposed takeover includes a $1 billion breakup fee for each party.

119.title: Plea seeking demolition of Gyanvapi Mosque wall to be heard today
119.article_body: A plea seeking the demolition of a wall beneath the wazu khana of the Gyanvapi Mosque will be heard by a Varanasi court on Wednesday. Advocate Vishnu Jain, appearing for the petitioners, said that they want the wall to be demolished and that they should be allowed to go there. He added the court will pronounce its verdict today itself.

120.title: I was named after Abhishek Bachchan, had to change my name due to him: Krushna
120.article_body: Comedian-actor Krushna Abhishek revealed his mother, who was Amitabh Bachchan's fan, named him after the actor's son, Abhishek Bachchan. He said, "My name had to be changed and made Krushna, also because of Abhishek." "When I got into acting, I was told there's...an actor by the name of Abhishek...they told me not to keep my name as Abhishek," he added.

121.title: UK MP arrested over rape & sex offences spanning 7 years
121.article_body: The UK Police have arrested an unnamed Conservative MP on suspicion of rape and sexual assault. The man is in his fifties and the investigation into the alleged offences, which took place between 2002 and 2009, is ongoing, police said. The man also faces allegations of abuse of position of trust and misconduct in a public office.

122.title: Rahul Tripathi has got some real potential: Matthew Hayden
122.article_body: Former Australia opener Matthew Hayden has praised SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, stating that the 31-year-old has "real potential to go all the way at the international level". Hayden added, "He is someone [who] is a dangerous striker of the ball, he can hit both sides of the wicket." Tripathi scored his third fifty of IPL 2022 against MI on Tuesday.

123.title: Video shows Heard, Franco in elevator night before she filed for divorce from Depp
123.article_body: Footage has emerged of Hollywood actor James Franco visiting Amber Heard at her apartment the night before she filed for divorce from Johnny Depp. The footage, showing Heard and Franco in an elevator, was played to jurors in the courthouse. Heard confirmed that it was Franco in the video and that they were going to her penthouse.

124.title: I used to pull a truck for 8 km: Shoaib Akhtar on how he breached 160-kmph bowling speed
124.article_body: Talking about how he breached 160-kmph bowling speed, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said that he used to pull vehicles. "I began by running with tyres...Next, I started pulling small vehicles with my shoulders...[at night in Islamabad]," he added. He further said, "I started pulling a truck. I used to pull a truck for around 8 km."

125.title: Hyd-based devotee donates gold band worth ₹2 cr to Shirdi Saibaba Temple
125.article_body: A Hyderabad-based devotee has donated a band made of 4 kg of gold worth ₹2 crore to the Saibaba Temple in Maharashtra's Shirdi, the temple authorities said on Wednesday. The devotee, Parthsarthi Reddy, wished to donate the band for the throne of Saibaba's idol at the temple in 2016, but the procedure got delayed, the authorities added.

126.title: 'Narco tunnel' with a rail line uncovered between Mexico & US
126.article_body: US anti-narcotics agents have discovered a "narco tunnel" running from Mexico's Tijuana to a warehouse in US' San Diego. The tunnel, estimated to be about 1,744 feet long, had a rail track, electricity and a ventilation system. The agents were carrying out surveillance at a property previously used as a stash house for smuggling cocaine when they made the discovery.

127.title: Bus CCTV camera captures moment 2 buses collide head-on in Tamil Nadu, 30 injured
127.article_body: Around 30 people were injured in a head-on collision between two buses in Tamil Nadu's Salem district. The footage from the CCTV camera installed inside one of the buses, showing the collision, has gone viral. The video shows the bus driver thrown out of his seat while another man is seen hitting the windshield of the bus after the crash.

128.title: Anurag had told me 'Stop doubting yourself, you're good': Fatima on self-doubt
128.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh said that filmmaker Anurag Kashyap told her to "stop doubting" herself during the film 'Ludo'. "Dada had given me some sense of confidence...He used to tell me...you're good," she said, adding that she had self doubt during 'Modern Love: Mumbai', but director Shonali Bose said she was doing well.

129.title: Painting exchanged for cheese sandwich sold at auction for over ₹2 crore in Canada
129.article_body: A Canadian painting by artist Maud Lewis has been sold at an auction for CA$350,000 (over ₹2 crore) after coming to its owner in exchange for a grilled cheese sandwich. The painting was acquired by a chef named Irene Demas in the year 1973. "Mind you...It was a great sandwich, with a five-year-old cheddar and beautiful bread," Demas said.

130.title: Bus rams into truck on Yamuna Expressway in UP; 3 killed, 36 injured
130.article_body: A bus carrying 60 people rammed into a truck on the Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura leaving three dead and injuring 36 others, police said. The passengers were returning to Delhi after offering prayers in Vrindavan, police added. The bus rammed into the truck laden with building material from behind, police further said.

131.title: US planning military aid package for India to reduce India's dependence on Russia: Report
131.article_body: US is preparing a military aid package for India to reduce the country's dependence on Russian weapons, according to a report quoting people familiar with the matter said. The package under consideration would include foreign military financing of as much as $500 million, the report added. However, it is unclear when the deal would be announced.

132.title: 2 labourers found dead at pipeline work site amid heavy rain in B'luru
132.article_body: Two labourers were found dead amid heavy rainfall at a pipeline work site in Bengaluru's Ullal on Wednesday. "The dead have been identified as Devbharath from Bihar and Ankit Kumar from Uttar Pradesh. The labourers were at the site...around 7 pm, the water levels rose," police said. Heavy rain has led to water-logging in several parts of the city.

133.title: Demolition drive underway in Delhi's Kalyan Puri, AAP MLA Kuldeep Kumar detained
133.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Kuldeep Kumar was detained by Delhi Police during a protest against the anti-encroachment drive of East Delhi Municipal Corporation in the Kalyan Puri area on Wednesday. Visuals from the drive, which is underway, showed shops being demolished. Delhi government has sought a detailed report from the civic bodies over the 'bulldozer' drive from April 1.

134.title: Protesting is farmers’ right but sloganeering isn’t the way: Punjab CM
134.article_body: Following a protest held by Punjab farmers near the Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday, CM Bhagwant Mann said that it’s their right to protest but sloganeering is not the way to do so. "I'll make everything right...I am ready to meet them (farmers) but 'murdabad' (sloganeering) is not the way...At least put in efforts," Mann added.

135.title: The journey has been far from smooth: Bezos on 25 yrs of Amazon's IPO
135.article_body: Amazon's Jeff Bezos shared a throwback picture of himself on social media on the occasion of 25 years of Amazon's IPO, saying the journey has been far from smooth. He also specified that the IPO share price was $1.50 on Twitter. "Lots of risk-taking, lots of invention, lots of mistakes, so much we still have to do better," he added.

136.title: BMC trims over 49,000 trees as part of pre-monsoon work
136.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) trimmed more than 49,167 trees as part of its pre-monsoon work this year after surveying around 1.50 lakh roadside trees. The civic body in its survey found that 1.02 lakh trees are in a dangerous condition. The trimming of the remaining trees will be completed before the monsoon using advanced machines, BMC officials said.

137.title: Canada bans entry of Putin, 1,000 other Russians over Ukraine war
137.article_body: Canada has announced a ban on the entry of Russia's President Vladimir Putin and 1,000 other Russian nationals in the country over the Ukraine war. Canadian Minister of Public Safety Marco Mendicino on Tuesday said, "In the face of the Putin regime's brutal attack, Canada stands with Ukraine and we will hold Russia accountable for its crimes."

138.title: Stopped from taking gun to fields for scaring cattle, UP man kills brother
138.article_body: A man killed his elder brother in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor after the latter stopped him from taking a gun into the fields. The accused, Brajveer, wanted to take his licensed double-barrel gun to the fields to scare away stray cattle. After being stopped, he got into an altercation with his elder brother and ended up firing at him.

139.title: Bengaluru Police recover 725-gram stolen gold; arrest 2
139.article_body: Police have arrested two people wanted in a theft case in Bengaluru and recovered 725 grams of stolen gold ornaments. North East Division Deputy Commissioner of Police, Anoop A Shetty, took to Twitter and congratulated the Amruthahalli Police for solving the case. Separately, the Amruthahalli Police have arrested two people involved in pickpocketing and robbing mobile phones from bus passengers.

140.title: Man held in Punjab for helping terror suspects to get fake RCs
140.article_body: A man was arrested from Punjab’s Kharar for allegedly helping some suspected Khalistani terrorists, who have been arrested, to procure fake registration certificates (RCs) for two stolen vehicles. The accused along with his associate, who was arrested earlier, used to purchase the vehicle from a third accused and they had sold two vehicles to the terror suspects.

141.title: Kane Williamson to miss rest of IPL 2022 for birth of his second child
141.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson will miss the rest of the IPL 2022 as he is exiting the bio-bubble to return to New Zealand for the birth of his second child. "Here's everyone at the #Riser camp wishing Kane Williamson and his wife a safe delivery and a lot of happiness," SRH posted on social media.

142.title: Hyd Police arrests Nigerian man for cheating women on matrimonial site
142.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a Nigerian man for cheating women on an international matrimonial site. The 24-year-old accused, who impersonated himself as a non-resident Indian (NRI) and cheated women, was arrested from Delhi following a complaint lodged in Rachakonda, police added. The accused contacted the complainant stating that he was an NRI and wanted to marry her, police stated.

143.title: Malayali vlogger Rifa Mehnu died by suicide, autopsy report suggests
143.article_body: The autopsy report of Malayali vlogger Rifa Mehnu, whose body was exhumed after her family raised doubts over her death, has suggested her death was caused by suicide. The 20-year-old vlogger was found dead in her house in Dubai by her husband Mehnu (Mehnaz) in March. "Police would proceed with the investigation into the case registered against Mehnaz," police said.

144.title: PhonePe to acquire WealthDesk, OpenQ, reportedly for $70 million
144.article_body: PhonePe has said it will acquire wealth tech platforms WealthDesk and OpenQ. The acquisitions together will amount to around $70 million, media reports said. PhonePe will reportedly buy WealthDesk for roughly $50 million. WealthDesk's founder and the entire team will be working as a part of PhonePe and it will continue to remain an open platform for all players.

145.title: Finland and Sweden formally apply to join NATO amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine
145.article_body: Amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Finland and Sweden on Wednesday formally applied to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO). "This is a historic moment, which we must seize," NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said. "You are our closest partners, and your membership in NATO will increase our shared security," Stoltenberg added.

146.title: Class 12 boy stabs friend to death in Tamil Nadu for repeatedly calling him 'girlish'
146.article_body: A Class 12 student stabbed his friend to death in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi district for repeatedly calling him 'girlish'. Police said that the victim continuously teased his classmate over his looks despite the latter's objection. Police registered a case of murder and sent the accused to a correctional centre. The accused also claimed the victim used to touch him inappropriately.

147.title: Actress Ketaki Chitale sent to 14-day judicial custody over post on Sharad Pawar
147.article_body: Thane court has sent Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale to 14-day judicial custody after her police custody ended. Ketaki had been arrested for allegedly sharing a derogatory post against NCP chief Sharad Pawar. She had claimed that Pawar was corrupt and had remarked upon his illness, appearance and voice in a Facebook post.

148.title: Supreme Court allows OBC reservation in local elections in Madhya Pradesh
148.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed the Madhya Pradesh government to implement Other Backward Classes (OBC) reservation in local body elections in the state. The court further directed the state Election Commission to notify the local body elections in one week. MP government had sought a 35% reservation for OBCs in the three-tier panchayat and urban local body polls.

149.title: We'll adapt the story to modern times: Producer Murad on Tezaab's remake
149.article_body: Film producer Murad Khetani, who has bankrolled films like 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Thadam' Hindi remake, has acquired the rights of the N Chandra directorial 'Tezaab'. According to reports, Murad will soon begin the pre-production work on the 'Tezaab' remake. Speaking about it the producer said, "We will adapt the story to modern times." The film was released in 1988.

150.title: Security tightened at Aurangzeb's tomb after MNS says it should be destroyed
150.article_body: The Maharashtra government ordered deployment of additional security outside Aurangzeb's tomb in Aurangabad after MNS leader Gajanan Kale called for destroying it. Kale also criticised AIMIM leader Akbaruddin Owaisi for visiting the tomb and said, "The Maharashtra government should take action against Owaisi...If no action is taken, then the MNS will take the matter into its own hands."

151.title: Unfollowing Kangana: Payal Rohatgi in Instagram note after losing 'Lock Upp'
151.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi, after losing the reality show 'Lock Upp', took to Instagram to share a note, saying that she is "unfollowing Kangana". "Kangana and lot of A-grade celebrities who came as guests on 'Lock Upp' called me bad**s...Maybe they didn't know...the meaning of it...in middle of the show and on finale Kangana realised it," she wrote.

152.title: Narine is tried and tested option as opener for KKR: Pragyan Ojha
152.article_body: Ahead of KKR's last league match of IPL 2022, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said Sunil Narine should open for KKR in the absence of Ajinkya Rahane. "Narine is a tried and tested option...at the top of the order. He is an attacking option. With that you can pick a player in the middle order as a dynamic option," Ojha explained.

153.title: Man accused of robbery surrenders with 'don’t shoot me' placard in UP
153.article_body: An alleged robber surrendered to police in UP's Budaun with a "don't shoot me" placard hung around his neck, an official said. The man along with his accomplice purportedly robbed a trader of ₹5 lakh. He approached the police station with the placard reading "Don't shoot me, I am surrendering due to the fear of police," a police official said.

154.title: Indrani granted bail in daughter Sheena's murder case, SC says 'Already spent 6.5 yrs in jail'
154.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted bail to Indrani Mukerjea, the prime accused in the case involving her daughter Sheena Bora's murder, saying that she has "already spent 6.5 years in jail". In December 2021, Mukerjea wrote a letter to the CBI claiming that Sheena is alive and is in Kashmir. The CBI had refuted the former media executive's claim.

155.title: Whenever India faced challenges, Cong leaders were enjoying abroad: Hardik Patel
155.article_body: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel, who quit Congress on Wednesday, said, "Whenever our country faced challenges and when the Congress needed leadership, Congress leaders were enjoying abroad." He added, "Whenever I met with the senior leadership, I always felt leaders were...more engrossed in what messages they had received on their mobile."

156.title: Hoax bomb call delays Gorakhpur-Bandra Humsafar Express by over 3 hours
156.article_body: The Gorakhpur-Bandra Humsafar Express (19092) was delayed by three and a half hours on Tuesday after it received a hoax bomb call on Twitter. A person identified as Milan Rajak tweeted that terrorists have planted a bomb inside the train to blow it up. However, after a thorough search, nothing incriminating was found on the train, the railway police informed.

157.title: ‘Return empty beer bottles’: Brewers in Germany flag shortage
157.article_body: Germany is facing a shortage of beer bottles, brewers in the country have warned. The chief executive of a German brewers' group, Holger Eichele, said the situation is extremely tense and that "we will see shortages by summer at the latest". Eichele advised the consumers to return the empty beer bottles as soon as possible to ease the situation.

158.title: Musk responds after Twitter employee says 'he is special needs, he has Asperger's'
158.article_body: Elon Musk has responded after a journalist shared a video in which a Twitter employee calls the Tesla CEO "special needs" and says that he has Asperger's. "Twitter exec trashing free speech & mocking people with Asperger's," Musk wrote. "I can't even take what Musk says seriously," the employee can be heard saying in the video.

159.title: It's up to Tilak now to prove Rohit Sharma right: Gavaskar
159.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said it's up to Tilak Varma to prove Rohit Sharma right in saying that the 19-year-old could be an all-format player for Team India. "It's up to Tilak to work that little bit extra, get his fitness going, get a little tighter as far as the technique is concerned and prove Rohit right," stated Gavaskar.

160.title: 1 dead after fire breaks out at banquet hall in Delhi's Ashok Vihar
160.article_body: At least one person died after a fire broke out at a banquet hall in Delhi's Ashok Vihar on Tuesday, police said. The victim was found unconscious and was declared dead at a hospital. "A fire that started at the ground floor of the banquet hall in PS Bharat Nagar area has been contained promptly," Delhi Police tweeted.

161.title: Send sweets to Mohan Bhagwat during his stay in WB: Mamata to police
161.article_body: Ahead of RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's West Bengal visit, CM Mamata Banerjee directed the police to remain vigilant and ensure that no riots break out during his stay. "Send him sweets and fruits on behalf of the administration. He should feel that we welcome our guests," Banerjee further said. Bhagwat will be staying in West Bengal's Keshiary for four days.

162.title: Racket providing fake educational certificates busted in Panipat, 1 held
162.article_body: A racket providing fake educational certificates was busted in Panipat, following which one member of the gang was arrested by the Crime Investigation Agency of the Panipat Police. The accused told the police that he was running this racket for the past five years. The gang members used to get a certificate for classes 10 and 12 at ₹5,000.

163.title: Is this legit: Musk on Twitter engineer's 'free speech' leaked recording
163.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reacted to the leaked recording of a top Twitter engineer saying the platform does not believe in free speech, saying, "Is this legit?" The video also showed Siru Murugesan saying Twitter employees "hated" Musk's $44 billion takeover bid. Responding to Musk, American columnist Benny Johnson claimed Twitter has acknowledged that the video is authentic.

164.title: I don't believe I'm hated; people are obsessed with me: Kangana on trolls
164.article_body: When asked about dealing with trolls and hatred, actress Kangana Ranaut said that she doesn't feel she is hated at all. "I find it very hard to believe that I might be hated," she said. "It's...difficult for me to believe. Either they love me, or they are obsessed. I don't think I'm hated as such," she added.

165.title: Tanker carrying chemical overturns, rams into divider in Thane; 2 injured
165.article_body: A tanker that was carrying 10 tonnes of chemical overturned in Thane after the driver reportedly lost control of the vehicle. The tanker then rammed into a divider. Two people were injured in the incident. Reports said that after the vehicle overturned, the chemical spilled over the road, causing traffic congestion on the Western Expressway Highway.

166.title: Burqa-clad terrorist attacks newly opened wine shop in J&K's Baramulla
166.article_body: A burqa-clad terrorist riding pillion on a bike that stopped near a newly opened wine shop in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla walked towards the shop and threw a grenade inside through the porthole window. The explosion killed one employee, leaving three others injured. They were rushed to a hospital. Police have cordoned the area and a search is on.

167.title: New York City raises COVID alert from 'medium' to 'high' as cases rise
167.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, New York City has raised its COVID-19 alert level from "medium" to "high". The rating means there is a high COVID-19 community spread in the city and pressure on the health care system is substantial.  Health authorities have advised New Yorkers to wear a face mask in all public indoor settings and crowded outdoor spaces.

168.title: Indian Army launches rescue operations in flood-hit  Assam
168.article_body: The Indian Army on Tuesday launched rescue operations in various parts of Assam's flood-hit Cachar and Hojai districts. "Security forces comprising of Army & Assam Rifles of Masimpur launched...rescue operations...on 17 May. Approximately, 500 villagers were rescued by the forces," Guwahati's Defence PRO tweeted. Meanwhile, around 100 people were rescued from the Hojai district by Gajraj Corps.

169.title: Yamuna water level 5.5 ft below normal, Delhi minister reviews situation
169.article_body: Water level in Yamuna was recorded at 669 feet on Tuesday at Delhi's Wazirabad barrage. This is 5.5 feet below the desired level of 674.5 feet. Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain carried out an on-site review of situation on Tuesday. "Due to...Haryana government's insufficient water release...water level at Wazirabad barrage has dropped from...its typical 674.5 feet to...669 feet," Jain said.

170.title: SC orders release of Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict Perarivalan after 31 yrs in jail
170.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday ordered the release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case. A bench of Justices L Nageswara Rao, BR Gavai and AS Bopanna passed the order on Perarivalan's plea seeking the suspension of his life sentence. AG Perarivalan had been behind bars for around 31 years.

171.title: Hardik Patel quits Congress, says 'Party played role of roadblock on national issues'
171.article_body: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel has resigned from the primary membership of Congress party. He said, "Be it the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, revocation of Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir, implementation of GST - India wanted solutions...Congress only played the role of roadblock." He added, "I believe after this step, I'll be able to work positively for Gujarat's people."

172.title: What will we eat, if we won’t work: Delhi labourers amid heatwave
172.article_body: Amid the unprecedented heatwave condition in Delhi, the construction workers working in the national capital said that they have no other option except to work for their livelihood. "If I take a day off then people at home will starve. We don't have any other options except to work. I have to look after my children," a construction worker said.

173.title: Europe ditching Russian oil is economic suicide: Putin
173.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said the EU wouldn't be able to impose a ban on Russian oil imports. "Some EU states, in whose energy balance the share of Russian hydrocarbons is especially high, won't be able to do this for...long time, to ditch our oil," Putin said. Europe would be committing an "economic suicide" by banning Russian oil, he added.

174.title: Centre pressuring states to purchase imported coal: Raj CM Gehlot
174.article_body: Centre is pressuring states to purchase imported coal, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot alleged. The price of imported coal is more than three times the price of coal being given by Coal India Limited, he added. "Centre had issued an advisory in 2021 to Rajasthan for 4% imported coal blending...in April, it has been made mandatory to buy 10%," Gehlot added.
