Joly's comment comes as Finland and Sweden have announced their intent to join the alliance, while the latter has also formally applied for the same. Finland and Sweden will require approval of all 30 member countries to join NATO.

351.title: Didn't donate $7mn divorce settlement to charity due to Depp's lawsuit: Heard
351.article_body: Amber Heard, during Johnny Depp's defamation trial, said she didn't donate the $7 million divorce settlement she received to charity as she promised. "I...intend on honouring...my pledges...would love Depp to stop suing me so I can," she said. Amber had pledged to split her entire settlement and donate it to American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) and Children's Hospital Los Angeles.

352.title: Neil Patrick Harris apologises for old Amy Winehouse joke
352.article_body: Actor Neil Patrick Harris has apologised for his old joke about late singer Amy Winehouse which he made shortly after her death. A Halloween dinner hosted by Neil and his husband 11 years ago featured a buffet platter made to look like the corpse of Amy. "It was regrettable then...it remains regrettable now...I'm sorry for...hurt this image caused," Neil stated.

353.title: Noida Authority to spend ₹24 crore to develop urban villages
353.article_body: The Noida Authority sanctioned ₹24 crore to develop villages by repairing and constructing roads, drains, footpaths and green spaces. The amount will be spent on 33 different projects to be completed by November 2022. "We decided to start work on these projects without any delay after the villagers made their demands on urgent basis," a senior Noida Authority official said.

354.title: US Special Coordinator for Tibet arrives on India and Nepal visit
354.article_body: US Special Coordinator for Tibetan Issues Uzra Zeya arrived in India on Tuesday to "deepen cooperation on human rights and democratic governance goals, and to advance humanitarian priorities". "Namaste! Great to be back in New Delhi," Zeya tweeted. She will also visit Nepal during the trip to hold discussions on the same areas with the country's government.

355.title: Discussions with Turkey can solve NATO objection issue: Finland Prez
355.article_body: Finnish President Sauli Niinisto said Finland and Sweden will be able to reach an agreement with Turkey over its objections to the two Nordic countries' plans to join NATO. "Statements from Turkey have very quickly changed and become harder during the last few days...But I am sure that, with the help of constructive discussions, we'll solve the situation," he added.

356.title: Kartik, Kiara visit Gurdwara Bangla Sahib ahead of Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 release
356.article_body: Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani jetted off to New Delhi where they visited Gurdwara Bangla Sahib to seek blessings ahead of the release of their upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. Photos and videos of the two visiting the Gurdwara have surfaced online. In the photos, Kiara has donned a neutral-toned salwar suit, while Kartik wore a white kurta and jeans.

357.title: Hard to see how SRH could possibly win their last 2 games: Lisa Sthalekar
357.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Lisa Sthalekar has said it's hard to see how SRH, who have lost their last five games in a row, could possibly win their remaining games in IPL 2022. "[In] last two games, they scored 120-odd runs. You aren't gonna win many games...like that," she added. SRH will face MI and PBKS in their last two league matches.

358.title: Motorists to get traffic e-challans on WhatsApp: Cyberabad Police
358.article_body: Cyberabad Police have informed that motorists who have violated traffic rules will soon be getting traffic e-challans on their WhatsApp numbers. Taking to Twitter, Cyberabad Police said, "Motorists violating traffic rules will soon be sent an e-challan with a photo of the violation to their WhatsApp [numbers]." "Preparations are underway to bring this policy within a week," Cyberabad Police added.

359.title: Char Dham yatra on Badrinath route stops as boulders fall from hill
359.article_body: Traffic movement on the Badrinath route near Panchpulia in Uttarakhand's Karnaprayag was disrupted after boulders fell from a hill on Tuesday. The Char Dham yatra through this route was stopped due to the closure of the highway. Efforts are underway to open the route for traffic. The yatra was earlier suspended on Monday due to heavy rainfall in the state.

360.title: 24-yr-old man dies in Moga due to 'shock' after injecting drugs, 2 held
360.article_body: A 24-year-old man died from purported "shock" after injecting narcotics into his body in Moga district on Monday. Ludhiana Police booked four persons and arrested two of them for allegedly supplying drugs to him. As per the deceased's family, he used to take drugs and on Sunday he had taken an injection, a police official said.

361.title: Olivia Colman, Jessie Buckley to reunite for 'Wicked Little Letters'
361.article_body: Oscar-winning actress Olivia Colman and 'Chernobyl' star Jessie Buckley are teaming up again, after 'The Lost Daughter', for a comedy film, 'Wicked Little Letters'. Thea Sharrock, known for directing 'Me Before You', has been roped in to helm the upcoming project. Thea said that 'Wicked Little Letters' is a divine comedy which is based on a true story.

362.title: Kareena, Jaideep & I are having a blast: Vijay Varma on shooting in Darjeeling
362.article_body: Speaking about shooting in Darjeeling for his upcoming project with Sujoy Ghosh, actor Vijay Varma said, "Darjeeling is...a beautiful...place with an old-world charm, it's a peaceful getaway." "Kareena, Jaideep and I are having a blast shooting...and...we're just lucky to be escaping the heatwave and enjoying the pleasant weather of this city and of course, their momos," he added.

363.title: Bulldozers will be used against innocent Muslims: Owaisi on Neemuch incident
363.article_body: Reacting to incidents of communal clashes in MP's Neemuch, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan and said, "We know Bulldozers will be used against innocent Muslims only." "Sir @CMMadhyaPradesh will your government arrest the accused for desecrating masjid and dargah," Owaisi said. Clashes broke out after some people placed Lord Hanuman's idol near a dargah in Neemuch.

364.title: Attendance through app made mandatory for MGNREGS workers: Report
364.article_body: The Centre has reportedly made it mandatory for workers under MGNREGS to time-stamp attendance through a mobile application and geo-tag photographs, rather than recording manual attendance. The decision related to time-stamp attendance is taken to find out loopholes in the programme and bring more transparency, the report said. Currently, there are 15 crore active workers registered under MGNREGS.

365.title: Wanted his autograph, but realised it wouldn't look good for 1st impression: Lee on Sachin
365.article_body: Brett Lee revealed that he met Sachin Tendulkar for the first time in 1999 when he was playing for Prime Minister's XI against touring Indian team. "I actually wanted to get his autograph...I thought I'll give him the ball and say...'Hey mate, could you please sign this?' but then realised it wouldn't look good for my first impression," he added.

366.title: SC Collegium recommends Satish Chandra as new Delhi HC chief justice
366.article_body: Supreme Court Collegium has recommended the transfer of Telangana High Court Chief Justice Satish Chandra Sharma as the new chief justice of the Delhi High Court. After the retirement of Justice DN Patel as the Delhi High Court Chief Justice, Justice Vipin Sanghi was appointed as the Acting Chief Justice. Now, Justice Sanghi has been transferred to Uttarakhand High Court.

367.title: We share deep love for each other: Harry Styles on One Direction bandmates
367.article_body: Harry Styles opened up on his One Direction days and his bond with his bandmates. He revealed how the band members always looked out for each other. "I feel really lucky that we always had each other," he said. "There is [so] much...respect between all of us...it's like a very deep love for each other, I think," he added.

368.title: Liam Livingstone is just the perfect modern T20 cricketer: Bhogle
368.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle has termed PBKS all-rounder Liam Livingstone "the perfect modern T20 cricketer". Bhogle added, "He bats anywhere, hits long...can give you four overs turning the ball away from right and left handers, fields well in the deep." Livingstone, who has 388 runs in 13 matches this IPL season, bowled off-spin and leg-spin to pick three wickets against DC.

369.title: 2 friends drown in Narmada backwaters in MP while swimming
369.article_body: Two friends, who went swimming in the backwaters of the Narmada river in Madhya Pradesh's Khandwa district, reportedly died after drowning on Sunday. Abhishek Kushwaha (23) and his friend Vikas Phoolmali (25) went to Sant Singaji Samadhi Sthal with their families and decided to go swimming. They reportedly ventured into deep waters, where they got trapped and drowned, police said.

370.title: 5 of family killed, 12 injured in road accident on Delhi-Jaipur highway
370.article_body: Five family members died while 12 persons were injured, when the multi-utility vehicle (MUV) they were travelling in, rammed into a stationary truck on the Delhi-Jaipur highway near Audhi village in Haryana on Tuesday. The deceased were residents of Jaipur in Rajasthan. They were returning from Haridwar after immersing the ashes of a relative.

371.title: Why does BJP hate Bhagat Singh: Kejriwal on K'taka's textbook decision
371.article_body: After reports of chapter on Bhagat Singh being removed from class 10 textbooks in Karnataka, Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal took to Twitter to ask, "Why do BJP people hate amar shaheed Sardar Bhagat Singh ji so much?" "Removal of Sardar Bhagat Singh ji's name...from school books is an...insult to the sacrifice of amar shaheed," his tweet further read.

372.title: Hyundai Santro discontinued in India again: Report
372.article_body: Hyundai Motor India has discontinued its hatchback Santro in India again due to an increase in vehicle prices resulting in falling demand for cars from the entry car buyers, The Economic Times reported. The last unit of the latest generation Santro was reportedly produced last week. Santro was relaunched in 2018 at a price of ₹3.9 lakh to ₹5.5 lakh.

373.title: Byju's in talks to acquire US-based edtech firm Chegg Inc or 2U Inc: Reports
373.article_body: Byju’s is in discussion to acquire a US-based online tutoring company and is likely to bid for either Chegg Inc or 2U Inc, as per reports. While Chegg’s market value was $2.3 billion as of Friday’s close, 2U had a market value of $756 million and more than $1 billion in debt and other liabilities.

374.title: N Korea COVID outbreak could've devastating impact on human rights: UN
374.article_body: The UN said that the measures taken by North Korea's government to fight the first reported COVID-19 outbreak could have "devastating" consequences for human rights in the country. The new restrictions may make it difficult for people to meet their basic needs, including getting enough food, UN Human Rights Office spokesperson Liz Throssell said. The country is under strict lockdown.

375.title: NCP MLA Jagtap narrowly escapes after bus, his car collide in Maha
375.article_body: NCP MLA Sangram Jagtap and three others had a narrow escape on Tuesday after a bus and the car they were travelling in collided in Maharashtra's Raigad, police said. The accident occurred after the bus driver suddenly changed lanes, a police official said. "While...car was badly damaged, none of us were hurt because of seat belts and airbags," Jagtap added.

376.title: Tribal man arrested for raping physically disabled woman in Jharkhand
376.article_body: A tribal man was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly raping a physically disabled woman in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district. The incident occurred on May 13 when the woman had gone to Kandidumri jungle to collect firewood, where the accused gagged her mouth and raped her, a police officer said. He also threatened the victim against informing anyone, the officer added.

377.title: Mali junta says soldiers backed by a Western state attempted coup
377.article_body: Mali's junta has claimed that it thwarted a coup attempt by soldiers who were supported by a "Western state", the name of which it did not reveal. A junta spokesperson said that the government condemned the "outrageous attack on state security, the purpose of which is to hinder - or even annihilate - the substantial efforts to secure our country".

378.title: Metal balls that fell from space in Gujarat might be from Chinese rocket: Experts
378.article_body: After pictures showed mysterious metal balls that fell from space at different locations in Gujarat's Anand district, some experts stated they may be debris of a Chinese rocket or fuel storage tanks of space launch vehicles. US-based astronomer Jonathan McDowell said the metal spheres are likely to be debris of Chinese rocket Chang Zheng 3B (CZ 3B).

379.title: Lawyer leading Gyanvapi Mosque video survey removed by Varanasi court
379.article_body: Advocate-Commissioner Ajay Kumar Mishra, who was leading the video survey team of the Gyanvapi Mosque complex in UP, was removed by a Varanasi court on Tuesday. The court-appointed commission that carried out the survey was given two additional days to submit the survey report. A hearing challenging the survey is currently underway in the Supreme Court.

380.title: Video shows Indian American student being bullied; school suspends him for 3 days
380.article_body: A video showing an Indian American student being bullied at a Texas school has been widely shared on social media. The video shows a student choking the Indian American boy after he refused to give up his seat. The parents of the bullied student said their son received a three-day suspension while the other student was handed a single-day suspension.

381.title: We worked in isolation; there was Hindi industry & Telugu industry: Deepika
381.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, who's a member of the Cannes jury this year, said it's "only a matter of time" until Indian cinema witnesses global breakthrough. "Globally, Indian...movies are...recognised but within India also we're seeing a shift," she added. "Earlier, we worked in isolation, there was...Hindi film industry...Telugu film industry...and now those guardrails are coming down," she said.

382.title: Going to Cannes is something I never imagined, can't wait to be there: Helly
382.article_body: Actress Helly Shah will be making her debut at the Cannes Film Festival this year. While speaking about her Cannes debut, the actress said, "Going to Cannes is something I never imagined. I can't wait to be there." Helly, who'll be launching the poster of her debut film 'Kaya Palat' at the event, added that she's nervous and "super excited".

383.title: We just don't know: Andrew Symonds' sister on what he was doing on a lonely road at night
383.article_body: On being asked what Andrew Symonds was doing on the lonely road late at night when he met with an accident, the late Australian cricketer's sister Louise Symonds said, "We just don't know." "It's just awful," she added. Queensland Police are investigating the crash and will prepare a report for the coroner.

384.title: How long are you going to carry him: RP Singh on SRH skipper Williamson
384.article_body: Talking about Kane Williamson, who has scored 208 runs from 12 matches so far in IPL 2022, RP Singh said that the SRH skipper can be dropped from playing XI as the results aren't coming through. "How long are you going to carry him? He is a professional cricketer as well," he added. Eighth-placed SRH will face MI today.

385.title: SC grants 3 months interim bail to Haridwar Dharam Sansad case accused
385.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday granted interim bail for three months to Jitendra Narayan Tyagi on medical grounds in connection with the Haridwar Dharam Sansad case involving alleged inflammatory speeches. Uttarakhand High Court had dismissed Tyagi's bail plea in March. The participants in the Sansad, organised from December 17-19 in 2021, were allegedly instigated to wage a war against Muslims.

386.title: At least 7 killed due to flood in Assam, rescue operation underway
386.article_body: At least seven people died and over two lakh people have been affected due to floods across Assam's 24 districts, the Assam State Disaster Management Authority said. The government has opened 55 relief camps, which are currently sheltering 32,959 people. Rescue operation in the flood-hit areas is being carried out by NDRF, SDRF, Fire and Emergency Services and local residents.

387.title: Ramp up COVID vaccination drive for kids aged 12-14: UP CM to officials
387.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday instructed officials to ramp up the ongoing COVID-19 vaccination drive for children aged 12-14 years. At present, over 77 lakh children in the 12-14 age group have been administered vaccine doses in state. The CM also directed authorities to undertake awareness campaigns and encourage those above 18 years to take the precaution dose.

388.title: 4 accused in 1993 Bombay serial bomb blast case arrested in Gujarat
388.article_body: Four people allegedly involved in the 1993 Bombay serial bomb blast case have been arrested by the Anti-Terrorists Squad in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. "We are investigating the exact role of the four accused in the bomb blasts and their purpose of coming to Ahmedabad," the ATS Additional Director General said. The blasts killed 257 persons and injured over 709.

389.title: Tomato prices rise up to ₹100 per kg in Bengaluru: Report
389.article_body: The retail price of tomatoes has risen to between ₹80 and ₹100 per kilogram in Bengaluru and adjoining areas, according to a report. This comes as the heavy rainfall and Cyclone Asani in Karnataka have greatly affected the tomato crop, resulting in skyrocketing prices, the report added. The prices of several other green vegetables have also reportedly witnessed a rise.

390.title: 2 arrested for stealing ₹7,900 & phone from man in Gurugram: Police
390.article_body: Two men were arrested by Gurugram Police on Monday for stealing cash worth ₹7,900 and a phone from a man in Shivaji Nagar on May 10. The police said that the victim had suffered minor injuries in the incident. Notably, a video of the incident, recorded on a CCTV camera of a hardware shop, was widely shared on social media.

391.title: Bharti Airtel's net profit rises over 2 fold YoY to ₹2,008 cr in Q4
391.article_body: Bharti Airtel on Tuesday reported a 165% YoY rise in its net profit in Q4 FY22 to ₹2,008 crore, against ₹759 crore in Q4 FY21. Its consolidated revenues in Q4 rose 22% YoY to ₹31,500 crore, up from ₹25,747 crore. Bharti Airtel's consolidated profit after tax for FY22 jumped to ₹4,255 crore from the loss of ₹15,083 crore in FY21.

392.title: Microsoft to 'nearly double' salaries to retain employees, raises stock option
392.article_body: Microsoft announced that it will "nearly double" its budget for merit-based employee pay increases in order to retain its employees. The company said it will also increase its annual stock options by 25%. In an email to Microsoft employees, CEO Satya Nadella wrote, "Because of the amazing work you do...we're making long-term investments in each of you."

393.title: My daughter appreciated me: Mahesh Babu on Sarkaru Vaari Paata's success
393.article_body: Speaking about his family's reaction to the success of his film 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata', Mahesh Babu said, "When I first saw 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' with my family, Gautham (son) shook my hand and hugged me. My daughter appreciated me for my acting in the movie." "My sincere thanks to...the cast, technicians and producers for giving me this blockbuster," he added.

394.title: Status of religious places should be as per Act: Kharge on Gyanvapi case
394.article_body: Reacting to the ongoing Gyanvapi mosque case, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that the matter is in court but status of all mosques, temples, and other spaces of religious worship in 1947 had to be maintained as such. He further said that Places of Worship Act 1991 was made regarding it. A few are trying to divide people, he added.

395.title: Aadhaar card registration camp to be set up for transgenders in Pune
395.article_body: Pune district collector's office along with the Bindu Queer Rights Foundation (BQRF) is set to organise a camp for transgender persons to help them register for their Aadhaar cards. Camp will ensure that persons without necessary documents are also able to apply for their cards, BQRF director Bindumadhav Khire said. "We're...reaching out to people in rural areas of...district," Khire added.

396.title: 3 killed, 25 injured as double-decker bus overturns on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
396.article_body: At least three people were killed and 25 others were severely injured after a double-decker bus overturned on Agra-Lucknow Expressway in Bangarmau area in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, officials said. The bus was carrying around 80-85 passengers and was on its way to Bihar from Rajasthan, Bangarmau SDM said. As many as 55 passengers sustained minor injuries, the SDM added.

397.title: LIC shares settle at ₹873 on first trading day, down 8% from issue price
397.article_body: The shares of India's largest insurer LIC ended the first day of trading at ₹872.70 on Tuesday, down ₹76.30, or 8.04%, from the issue price. The shares of LIC touched an intraday high of ₹920 and an intraday low of ₹860.10. Shares of LIC got listed at a discount of 8.62% in early trade over the issue price of ₹949.

398.title: Talks with Ukraine are not going on in any form: Russia
398.article_body: Russia and Ukraine are not holding talks "in any form", Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Andrey Rudenko was quoted as saying by the Interfax news agency on Tuesday. "Ukraine has practically withdrawn from the negotiation process," Rudenko added. Russia began invading its neighbour Ukraine on February 24, and since then, thousands of civilians have been killed in the war.

399.title: Nushrratt to play female lead in remake of Prabhas' 'Chatrapathi'
399.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha has been roped in to play the female lead in the Hindi remake of Prabhas' 2005 Telugu film 'Chatrapathi'. The upcoming film will also mark the Bollywood debut of Bellamkonda Sreenivas, who will play the lead role. Rajamouli's father Vijayendra Prasad, who wrote the story for the original, has penned the script of the remake as well.

400.title: BJP trying to weaken Congress by raiding its members: Kharge
400.article_body: Congress MP Mallikarjun Kharge said the BJP is trying to weaken Congress by raiding its members. His statement comes as CBI conducted searches at multiple locations of Congress' Karti Chidambaram in connection with an ongoing case. "Chidambaram (Senior Congress leader) is a good lawyer and economist. This is the effect of speeches and debates he participates in," Kharge said.

401.title: 430 kg of tea adulterated with chemical seized in Mumbai, 2 arrested
401.article_body: Mumbai Police have seized 430 kg of adulterated tea worth ₹85,000 from a slum pocket in Mumbai's Sewree and arrested two men. The duo have no licence to sell or stock tea. "They adulterated tea with a chemical to give it a scent and a taste," police said. "Such tea has no benefits...and is harmful to...health," they added.

402.title: Bill Gates lists 3 steps that may ensure COVID-19 is the last pandemic
402.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates has said the world needs to work on three key areas to ensure COVID-19 is the last pandemic. He listed investing in better vaccines, therapeutics and diagnostics as first step. Second step is improving disease monitoring, with Gates suggesting creation of GERM (Global Epidemic Response and Mobilization) team. The third key area is strengthening health systems.
